programme.title: A Long Weekend in... With Rory O'Connell
programme.desc: Rory O’Connell’s brand new series combines travel and cookery with the popular chef enjoying the culture as well as the cuisine of eight European cities – Palma de Mallorca, Vienna, Lisbon, Madrid, Bath, Nantes, Copenhagen and Edinburgh. Rory visits a different city in each episode, and while the primary focus is on food, Rory is a knowledgeable guide to so much more, with art and design being particular interests of his. Food becomes much more interesting when seen in context – the culture it is part of the landscape it’s produced in, the history that has influenced it. At the end of each episode, Rory makes a delicious dish with the local produce which he sources on his travels.

programme.title: Discover The World: Vietnam The New Light Of The East
programme.desc: The word "Vietnam" once evoked memories of the ominous 1970s war, but today's Vietnam presents itself to the world as a welcoming country.

programme.title: Discover The World: Indonesia, Nature Of The Earth
programme.desc: One striking feature of Indonesia, even from the air, is the vibrant greenery of Bali, making it resemble an immense golf course that covers the entire island.

programme.title: Places To Love
programme.desc: Samantha joins third-generation deli-man, Ziggy Gruber, in the kitchen to make matzoh ball soup then discusses Ziggy's storied family/deli history, and why his Houston-based Kenny and Ziggy's New York Delicatessen is tops in the nation. Freedmen's Town was originally a community located in the fourth ward of Houston that began in 1865 as the destination for former enslaved people from surrounding plantations in Texas and Louisiana after the Civil War.

programme.title: Epic Exploring
programme.desc: In Epic Exploring, YouTube stars Josh & Cody are on a mission. This time, Urban explorerer Josh Yozura visits the forbidden city near Berlin.

programme.title: The Magic Of...
programme.desc: Botique travel series focusing on regions

programme.title: A Long Weekend in... With Rory O'Connell
programme.desc: Rory O’Connell’s brand new series combines travel and cookery with the popular chef enjoying the culture as well as the cuisine of eight European cities – Palma de Mallorca, Vienna, Lisbon, Madrid, Bath, Nantes, Copenhagen and Edinburgh. Rory visits a different city in each episode, and while the primary focus is on food, Rory is a knowledgeable guide to so much more, with art and design being particular interests of his. Food becomes much more interesting when seen in context – the culture it is part of the landscape it’s produced in, the history that has influenced it. At the end of each episode, Rory makes a delicious dish with the local produce which he sources on his travels.

programme.title: Raw Travel
programme.desc: Travel darling Krakow, Poland feels like a fairy tale with looming castles, medieval courtyards and even fire breathing dragons. But more modern history of the horrors of World War II and an occupation of communist rule did not leave Krakow unscathed. Today Krakow is a progressive and friendly city that invites travelers the world over to sample its layered history and many charms.

programme.title: The Colours of China
programme.desc: Five colours are an integral part of contemporary China and the ancient philosophy of Wu Xing. Each episode takes us to regions where we meet our characters, learn how Wu Xing sits in their lives and explore the landscapes they live in.

programme.title: Gourmet Escapes
programme.desc: Chef Massimo Capra loves big game and Yukon, Canada has some of the biggest game in the world. He meets up with Michele Ginest, who is a foremost expert in cooking big game. He get a lesson from a female moose hunter on moose calling and she also supplies him with the Moose meat for dinner. Chef Massimo goes out into the countryside to forage for the rest of the ingredients with Michele that include mushrooms and berries, they even go to forage at the World's smallest desert located in Yukon, Canada. The end result has to be an astonishing meal.

programme.title: It’s How You Get There
programme.desc: Sam Nehme, Julian Taylor and Jenn Barlow experience a variety of exciting modes of transportation as they journey across the country to see which one is best on, "It's How You Get There".

programme.title: American Travelers
programme.desc: Dave and Kari visit the tiny island of Isla Mujeres near Cancun Mexico.

programme.title: Hayman's Way
programme.desc: Follow David Hayman as he unearths the people and places that make Scotland unique.

programme.title: Todo Bien
programme.desc: Baja holds an almost mystical reputation in the overland community. In this series MAK and Owen traverse the full length of the Baja peninsula and explore the landscapes, wildlife and culture. They also sprinkle in tips for traveling in Baja to help anyone curious about travel south of the border.
